co.poynt.os.services.v1

Interface IPoyntConfigurationService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IPoyntConfigurationService.Stub

    public interface IPoyntConfigurationService
extends IInterface
    Provides interfaces to get and set terminal (card reader) configuration. This includes EMV config (AID, CA keys, etc.) and Terminal Config. All calls require the necessary permissions declared in the caller's Android Manifest file. Please refer to Poynt OS Permissions for more details.
    Since:
    1.0-beta4

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IPoyntConfigurationService.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

      int getGPRSCheckPeriod()
      Get the interval in milliseconds at which to check gprs registration after the first registration mismatch of gprs and voice service, to detect possible data network registration problems.
      int getPDPErrorPollCount()
      Get the number of polls to perform (at #PDP_WATCHDOG_ERROR_POLL_INTERVAL_MS) after hitting #PDP_WATCHDOG_TRIGGER_PACKET_COUNT before attempting data connection recovery.
      int getPDPErrorPollPeriod()
      Get the interval in milliseconds at which to check packet counts on the mobile data interface after #PDP_WATCHDOG_TRIGGER_PACKET_COUNT outgoing packets has been reached without incoming packets.
      int getPDPMaxResetFailCount()
      Get the number of failed PDP reset attempts before moving to something more drastic: re-registering to the network.
      int getPDPPollPeriod()
      Get the interval in milliseconds at which to check packet counts on the mobile data interface when screen is on, to detect possible data connection problems.
      int getPDPPollPeriodLong()
      Get the interval in milliseconds at which to check packet counts on the mobile data interface when screen is off, to detect possible data connection problems.
      int getPDPTriggerPacketCount()
      Get the number of outgoing packets sent without seeing an incoming packet that triggers a countdown (of #PDP_WATCHDOG_ERROR_POLL_COUNT device is logged to the event log
